content.text:
woo, another LED art hacker!

i use a BeagleBone Black, [a cape from RGB-123](http://rgb-123.com/product/beaglebone-black-24-output-cape/), [the Ledscape library](https://github.com/Yona-Appletree/LEDscape), either WS28012B or the new APA102 (which are like the old WS2801, my fav) grids or strips, and a fat blob of JavaScript.

[1614434_10206454331651096_887999461891506870_o.jpg](&JWofdARjh61uDtdUl5ivwYEPJ4T9TWMyztpgPlgkgek=.sha256)

i'm working on a module ecosystem which revolve around [ndsamples](https://github.com/livejs/ndsamples) and [ndpixels](https://github.com/livejs/ndpixels)). [here's a shitty example of the full stack that's currently running on hardware](https://github.com/ahdinosaur/pixelbeat/tree/reactive). [here's another example using ndsamples and virtual dom](dinosaur.is/svg-oscilloscope).

it all works well with streams (currently node streams, i'm considering once i get back to art hacking on these i'll port to pull streams) and allow you to develop to many possible outputs ([terminal](https://github.com/ahdinosaur/2dpixels-terminal), [canvas](https://github.com/ahdinosaur/2dpixels-canvas), [opc](https://github.com/ahdinosaur/ndpixels-opc)).

if anyone else is keen, let's collaborate. :rainbow:
